posts.post_content:
This card is great, but not perfect. I've been frustrated many times by him being removed from the game with {W} via [Path To Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path To Exile). Arguably better than [Inkwell Leviathan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inkwell Leviathan), as although Inkwell has shroud, it's still only a 7/11 creature, as compared to Mr. Darksteel being an 11/11. Inkwell can also be killed by something like a [Woolly Thoctar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Woolly Thoctar) combo-ed with a [Knight Of New Alara](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight Of New Alara) and a [Sigil Blessing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigil Blessing) to suprise you once you've declared him a blocker. Although, Inkwell's shroud does come in handy with all the cards that remove targets from the battlefield. Darksteel wins against [Wrath Of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath Of God )  or [Planar Cleansing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Planar Cleansing) though. ((:  
  
In all, a great, relatively stable card that any deck that wants to make full use of [Master Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuter) or [Elvish Piper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Piper) should have. 4.5/5
posts.html:
This card is great, but not perfect. I've been frustrated many times by him being removed from the game with {W} via Path To Exile. Arguably better than Inkwell Leviathan, as although Inkwell has shroud, it's still only a 7/11 creature, as compared to Mr. Darksteel being an 11/11. Inkwell can also be killed by something like a Woolly Thoctar combo-ed with a Knight Of New Alara and a Sigil Blessing to suprise you once you've declared him a blocker. Although, Inkwell's shroud does come in handy with all the cards that remove targets from the battlefield. Darksteel wins against Wrath Of God or Planar Cleansing though. ((:

In all, a great, relatively stable card that any deck that wants to make full use of Master Transmuter or Elvish Piper should have. 4.5/5

posts.post_content: Sure, he's big and all, but he's rather easy to get rid of in comparison to [Inkwell Leviathan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inkwell Leviathan). He's too expensive to cast, so he won't see play in limited. And in constructed, even though you can use [Tinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tinker) and [Master Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuter) and such, he's just going to be [Cryptic Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cryptic Command)ed, [Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile)d, [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares)'d or whatever. He's ugly, too.
posts.html:

Posted By: Lestat13 (7/11/2009 3:16:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: An indestructible 11/11 with trample would be awesome enough on its own, but the fact that he's a colourless artifact creature just makes him that much better. You can put him in a deck with lots of other big guys and launch a frenzied \*\*\*ault every chance you get, or you can throw him into a Blue deck with some other good colourless cards (Platinum Angel, maybe) to provide some firepower. If you're feeling really evil, give him a Whispersilk Cloak to give him shroud and make him unblockable ( at which point your opponent congratulates you on your victory).
posts.html:
